oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis of (E)-nitroolefins via decarboxylative nitration using t-butylnitrite (t-BuONO) and TEMPO
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MANNA, S
JANA, S
SABOO, T
MAJI, A
MAITI, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ARYLBORONIC ACIDS
NITROOLEFINS
NITROALKENES
ALKENES
OLEFINS
NITROSTYRENES
HYDROGENATION
NITROARENES
DERIVATIVES
CONVENIENT
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nitroolefins are usually synthesized using the Henry reaction. Here we report an alternative metal-free decarboxylative nitration protocol for the preparation of the nitroolefins from alpha,beta-unsaturated carboxylic acids using t-butylnitrite (t-BuONO) and TEMPO. alpha,beta-Unsaturated carboxylic acids bearing beta-aromatic and beta-heteroaromatic substituents gave (E)-nitroolefins exclusively under mild conditions. A radical based pathway has been proposed for this decarboxylative nitration reaction.
